physicalLayer

Class PhysicalLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • physicalLayer.PhysicalLayer

  • public class PhysicalLayer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to model a 2D grid-world environment with different objects placed in it.
    Version:
    v1.2
    Author:
    Chloe M. Barnes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Agent> agents
      A collection storing the agents in the environment.
      private int cols
      The number of columns.
      private Cell[][] grid
      A 2D array of cells which represents the environment.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[][]> landscapes
      A collection of the activation landscapes of the agents, which they use to hill-climb towards their goals.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources
      A collection of the Resource objects in the environment, which are to be collected so goals can be achieved.
      private int rows
      The number of rows.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicalLayer(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a new environment with a specified size, and sets up the objects contained within the environment such as Stones, Traps, Water and Resources.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAgent(Agent a)
      Adds an Agent to the environment, and allocates its target Resource objects.
      boolean agentAliveStatus(int i)
      Returns whether a specified agent in the environment is alive or not.

      Returns the fitness of a specified agent in the environment.
      Cell getAgentLocation(int i)
      Returns the location of a specified agent in the environment.
      int getAgentMoves(int i)
      Returns the number of moves a specified agent has taken in the environment.
      java.util.ArrayList<Agent> getAgents()
      Returns a collection of the agents within the environment.
      private double[] getAgentStatus(int i)
      Returns the status of a specified agent in the environment as an array, based on where it currently is in the environment etc.
      Cell getCell(int x, int y)
      Returns the Cell at a specified location in the environment.
      int getCols()
      Returns the number of columns the environment has.
      java.lang.Double[][] getLandscape(int i)
      Returns the activity landscape for a specified agent.
      int getNumAgents()
      Returns the number of agents in the environment.
      int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows the environment has.
      void reset()
      Reset the environment to a clean state.
      void resetAll()
      Reset the environment to a clean state.
      private void setup()
      Initialise the environment and setup with a standard arrangement of objects: stones, a river and resources.
      void update()
      Simulates one timestep where agents will move if they are alive.

    • Field Detail

      • grid

        private Cell[][] grid
        A 2D array of cells which represents the environment.

      • rows

        private int rows
        The number of rows.

      • cols

        private int cols
        The number of columns.

      • agents

        private java.util.ArrayList<Agent> agents
        A collection storing the agents in the environment.

      • resources

        private java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources
        A collection of the Resource objects in the environment, which are to be collected so goals can be achieved.

      • landscapes

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[][]> landscapes
        A collection of the activation landscapes of the agents, which they use to hill-climb towards their goals. Used in ActivityLandscapeView.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicalLayer

        public PhysicalLayer(int rows,
                     int cols)
        Creates a new environment with a specified size, and sets up the objects contained within the environment such as Stones, Traps, Water and Resources.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows the environment has.
        cols - The number of columns the environment has.

    • Method Detail

      • addAgent

        public void addAgent(Agent a)
        Adds an Agent to the environment, and allocates its target Resource objects.
        Parameters:
        a - The agent to add to the environment.

      • getAgents

        public java.util.ArrayList<Agent> getAgents()
        Returns a collection of the agents within the environment.
        Returns:
        The agents in the environment.

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int x,
                    int y)
        Returns the Cell at a specified location in the environment.
        Parameters:
        x - The row of the Cell in the environment.
        y - The column of the Cell in the environment.
        Returns:
        The Cell object at the specified location.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns the number of rows the environment has.
        Returns:
        The number of rows.

      • getCols

        public int getCols()
        Returns the number of columns the environment has.
        Returns:
        The number of columns.

      • update

        public void update()
        Simulates one timestep where agents will move if they are alive.

      • getNumAgents

        public int getNumAgents()
        Returns the number of agents in the environment.
        Returns:
        The number of agents in the environment.

      • agentAliveStatus

        public boolean agentAliveStatus(int i)
        Returns whether a specified agent in the environment is alive or not.
        Parameters:
        i - The agent to check.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is alive, false otherwise.

      • getAgentMoves

        public int getAgentMoves(int i)
        Returns the number of moves a specified agent has taken in the environment.
        Parameters:
        i - The agent to check.
        Returns:
        The number of moves the agent has taken.

      • getAgentLocation

        public Cell getAgentLocation(int i)
        Returns the location of a specified agent in the environment.
        Parameters:
        i - The agent to check.
        Returns:
        The Cell that the agent resides in in the environment.

      • evaluateAgent

        public double evaluateAgent(int maxMoves,
                            int i)
        Returns the fitness of a specified agent in the environment.
        Parameters:
        maxMoves - The maximum number of moves an agent can make in the environment.
        i - The agent to check.
        Returns:
        The calculated fitness of the specified agent.

      • getLandscape

        public java.lang.Double[][] getLandscape(int i)
        Returns the activity landscape for a specified agent. Used for ActivityLandscapeView.
        Parameters:
        i - The agent in which the landscape should be returned.
        Returns:
        The landscape of the specified agent.

      • resetAll

        public void resetAll()
        Reset the environment to a clean state. Reset all objects and remove all agents from the environment.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the environment to a clean state. Reset all objects, and reset the agents that are within the environment.

      • getAgentStatus

        private double[] getAgentStatus(int i)
        Returns the status of a specified agent in the environment as an array, based on where it currently is in the environment etc.
        Parameters:
        i - The agent to check.
        Returns:
        An array of the agent status: [grass, resource, stone, water, isCarrying, partialBridgeExists], where values will be 1 if true and 0 otherwise.

      • setup

        private void setup()
        Initialise the environment and setup with a standard arrangement of objects: stones, a river and resources.
